subhead: EU member states are meeting with Volodymyr Zelensky on Thursday, aiming to extend their support for Kyiv. This has become imperative as Donald Trump now seems to be getting closer to Moscow once again, even though his meeting with Vladimir Putin was indefinitely postponed.

More French voters leaning to the far right, poll shows
subhead: Marine Le Pen's far-right Rassemblement National party is well ahead in voter preferences, according to the 13th annual 'French Fractures' survey by Ipsos for Le Monde, the Jean Jaurès Foundation, CEVIPOF and the Montaigne Institute.

title: A new Israeli-Palestinian restaurant promotes peace through food in Paris
subhead: Edgar Laloum and Radjaa Aboudagga have just opened Sababa in Paris, offering bicultural culinary specialties. The two partners hope that, through the joys of culinary arts, they can help foster understanding and peace between communities.

title: Fate of Palestinian leader Marwan Barghouti remains uncertain
subhead: The former leader of the Second Intifada, imprisoned in Israel for 23 years, was not among the prisoners released in exchange for Israeli hostages. Seen as a unifying figure and resistance fighter, he is regarded as the leading successor to Mahmoud Abbas, the aging president of the Palestinian Authority.

title: The Louvre's history of burglaries
subhead: Several paintings have been stolen from the celebrated Parisian museum, including the Mona Lisa. Over the course of its history, it has steadily improved its security.

title: How Gustave Courbet's 'Le Désespéré' came to be owned by Qatar
subhead: The emirate purchased the painting for around €50 million about a decade ago from a French family and has agreed to loan it to the Musée d'Orsay for five years.
